comments.body: Do you really need C++14? We normally compile with C++17. Please add a comment.
Unfortunately yes. Noticing that osx compiles with C++ 14 was the key to understanding why the OSX build was successful whilst the Linux build wasn't. I will add the comment on the file.
Apologies, I am late for the party. Just a quick note: I prefer using `-DCMAKE_CXX_STANDARD=14` instead of passing `-std=c++14` manually to `CXXFLAGS` when using `cmake`

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2,6 @@    cmake  ${CMAKE_ARGS} .      
elif [[ "${target_platform}" == linux-* ]]; then
    export CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS -std=c++14"
    cmake  ${CMAKE_ARGS} .    
fi
